page.title: 12Bookham Churches
page.content:
There are a number of well attended churches in the area. 2 are Anglican; St.Nicolas at Bookham & St.Marys at Fetcham. Both churches date back to Saxon times but have modern church halls and recently a new rectory has been built in Bookham.
There are also 2 Catholic Churches at Effingham & Fetcham, a Baptist Church in the centre of Bookham and a United Reformed Church. All the churches support their own clergy.
On an average Sunday, St.Nicolas can have 300-400 in the congregation. This suggests that the churches have a fair influence on Bookham life. Each year there are occasions for ecumenical worship, either in the Barn Hall or as the climax to Village Week, an open air service in St.Nicolas churchyard.
